com.apigee.sdk.apm.android
Class ApigeeMonitoringClient

java.lang.Object
  com.apigee.sdk.apm.android.ApigeeMonitoringClient
All Implemented Interfaces:
SessionTimeoutListener
public class ApigeeMonitoringClient
extends java.lang.Object
implements SessionTimeoutListener

Initializes API BaaS App Monitoring, including crash, usage metrics and log interception. Generally, this should be instantiated via ApigeeClient, rather than directly.

See Also:
ApigeeClient, App Monitoring documentation

UPLOAD_INTERVAL

public static final int UPLOAD_INTERVAL
Metrics upload interval. Every 300000 milliseconds by default.

Method Detail

initialize

public static ApigeeMonitoringClient initialize(AppIdentification appIdentification,
                                                ApigeeDataClient dataClient,
                                                Context appActivity,
                                                MonitoringOptions monitoringOptions)
                                         throws InitializationException
Default constructor for starting App Monitoring. Generally, should not be called directly. Initializing the SDK with ApigeeClient will call this via AppMon.

Parameters:
appIdentification - an AppIdentification object that identifies the API BaaS organization and application to start App Monitoring for
dataClient - the instance of DataClient created when ApigeeClient was instantiated
appActivity - an application Context object
monitoringOptions - a MonitoringOptions object for specifying App Monitoring options
Returns:
the initialized MonitoringClient
Throws:
InitializationException
See Also:
AppMon

initialize

public static ApigeeMonitoringClient initialize(AppIdentification appIdentification,
                                                ApigeeDataClient dataClient,
                                                Context appActivity,
                                                org.apache.http.client.HttpClient client,
                                                MonitoringOptions monitoringOptions)
                                         throws InitializationException
Constructor for starting App Monitoring with a specified HttpClient. Generally, should not be called directly. Initializing the SDK with ApigeeClient will call this.

Parameters:
appIdentification - an AppIdentification object that identifies the API BaaS organization and application to start App Monitoring for
dataClient - the instance of DataClient created when ApigeeClient was instantiated
appActivity - an application Context object
monitoringOptions - a MonitoringOptions object for specifying App Monitoring options
Returns:
the initialized MonitoringClient
Throws:
InitializationException
See Also:
AppMon

discardAllMetrics

public void discardAllMetrics()

isPaused

public boolean isPaused()
Determine if monitoring is currently paused

Returns:
boolean indicating whether monitoring is currently paused

pause

public void pause()
Pauses monitoring. If monitoring is already paused when pause is called, there is no change to monitoring functionality, but a log message is generated.

resume

public void resume()
Resumes monitoring after being paused. If monitoring is not paused when resume is called, there is no change to monitoring functionality, but a log message is generated.

resumeAgent

public void resumeAgent()
Deprecated. 

Resumes monitoring after being paused. If monitoring is not paused when resume is called, there is no change to monitoring functionality, but a log message is generated.

See Also:
resume()

pauseAgent

public void pauseAgent()
Deprecated. 

Pauses monitoring. If monitoring is already paused when pause is called, there is no change to monitoring functionality, but a log message is generated.

See Also:
pause()
